com.readytalk.swt.widgets.notifications

Class BubbleRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.readytalk.swt.widgets.notifications.BubbleRegistry

  • public class BubbleRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
    A singleton that keeps track of all Bubble'd items and their (optional) associated tags.
    Users can use this class to Show and Hide Bubbles by tag or just show all the Bubbles.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void dismissAllBubbles()
      Dismiss all bubbles
      Remember to invoke this method if you previously invoked showAllBubbles
      void dismissBubblesByTag(BubbleTag... tags)
      Dismiss all bubbles corresponding to the list of tags.
      Remember to invoke this method if you previously invoked showBubblesByTags
      static BubbleRegistry getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of BubbleRegistry.
      void showAllBubbles()
      Shows all of the Bubbles at once.
      It's important to provide a way for users to invoke the dismissBubblesByTags() method because we disable the auto-hide and "Click-To-Dismiss" feature when this method is invoked.
      void showBubblesByTags(BubbleTag... tags)
      Show all bubbles corresponding to list of tags.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static BubbleRegistry getInstance()
        Returns the singleton instance of BubbleRegistry.
        Returns:
        The instance of BubbleRegistry.

      • showBubblesByTags

        public void showBubblesByTags(BubbleTag... tags)
        Show all bubbles corresponding to list of tags. It's important to provide a way for users to invoke the dismissBubblesByTags() method because we disable the auto-hide and "Click-To-Dismiss" feature when this method is invoked.
        Parameters:
        tags - The tag(s) you want to show the user.

      • showAllBubbles

        public void showAllBubbles()
        Shows all of the Bubbles at once.
        It's important to provide a way for users to invoke the dismissBubblesByTags() method because we disable the auto-hide and "Click-To-Dismiss" feature when this method is invoked. Be really sure you want to do this. If you use Bubble for tooltips all over your system, this will likely overwhelm your users. Also, Bubbles can overlap, so invoke this method at your own risk.

      • dismissBubblesByTag

        public void dismissBubblesByTag(BubbleTag... tags)
        Dismiss all bubbles corresponding to the list of tags.
        Remember to invoke this method if you previously invoked showBubblesByTags
        Parameters:
        tags - The tag(s) you want to dismiss.

      • dismissAllBubbles

        public void dismissAllBubbles()
        Dismiss all bubbles
        Remember to invoke this method if you previously invoked showAllBubbles
